I made some changes to fix the compatibility issues for upgrades and rollbacks, please help to review, thanks. @RongtongJin @tianliuliu
@lizhimins  Hello, I find this issue is closed as completed status. How do I use this feature?

@ShadowySpirits  Hi,  I am trying to use tiered store. Thanks for your work.

PTAL

> @ShadowySpirits Hi, I am trying to use tiered store. Thanks for your work.
> 
> PTAL

I prefer `filepath`. Actually, the difference between `filePath` and `filepath` is discussed in an early issue: https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/pull/6483#discussion_r1149143324.
hello，man  I have same problem with you ,Do you have solve your problem?

> > @ShadowySpirits Hi, I am trying to use tiered store. Thanks for your work.
> > PTAL
> 
> I prefer `filepath`. Actually, the difference between `filePath` and `filepath` is discussed in an early issue: [#6483 (comment)](https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/pull/6483#discussion_r1149143324).

I can accept both `filepath` and `filePath `.   Now code and documentation are incompatible. I found change tiered store path failed in broker.conf when  it isn't consistent.
Which one should we change?  @ShadowySpirits  

org.apache.rocketmq.tieredstore.common.TieredMessageStoreConfig#tieredStoreFilePath

LGTM

IMO. Trace message would bring extra message to broker, which would reduce the real produce TPS limit, it should be configured at the client side. Maybe you could change the client side, set the configuration `enableMsgTrace` with `true` by default, and user can set it to false if they didn't need trace message.
I'm experiencing the same thing I'm fine locally I deployed a Java client on top of centos link sending Reported error java.util.concurrent.CancellationException: Task was cancelled.

Although this functionality can be implemented on the server side, it will lack some information, such as production time data. This can currently only be generated on the client side.
